name: How to Be a Grown Up
original_name: How to Be a Grown Up
overview: Comics offer humorous advice and common-sense solutions to universal issues facing all adults who feel like they're a kid stuck in a grown-up body through interviews, sketches and animation.

episodes.name: The Birds, the Bees and Beyond
episodes.overview: The series premiere features advice on marriage proposals, getting in shape, mini-van ownership and talking sex with kids.

episodes.name: Coffee, Cooking and Sex After Kids
episodes.overview: Discussions on dealing with gray hair, caffeine and arguments.

episodes.name: Dining, Doctors & Decorating
episodes.overview: Dealing with in-laws; dining with kids; doctor visits; sex tips.

episodes.name: Playdates, New Friends and Caught in the Act
episodes.overview: Personal grooming; handling a mid-life crisis; bar drinking; surviving play dates.

episodes.name: Diets, Hairdos and No Sex for You
episodes.overview: The How to Be a Grown Up comics provide jokes and personal anecdotes on how to turn down sex, dress your kids, choose the right diet, party down with your co-workers and a whole lot more.

episodes.name: Money, Neighbors and Dirty Diapers
episodes.overview: The How to Be a Grown Up comics provide jokes and personal anecdotes on how to visit your parents, go on vacation, change a diaper, handle money, and a whole lot more...

episodes.name: Cars, Cops and Party Fouls
episodes.overview: The How to Be a Grown Up comics provide jokes and personal anecdotes on how to throw a party, deal with the police, buy a house, be a cool parent and a whole lot more.

episodes.name: Beaches, Barbecues and Baldness
episodes.overview: The How to Be a Grown Up comics provide jokes and personal anecdotes on how to throw a BBQ, have fun at a wedding, deal with going bald, say no to your kids and a whole lot more.

episodes.name: Dressing, Lying and Christmas Cheer
episodes.overview: The How to Be a Grown Up comics provide jokes and personal anecdotes on how to dress, play sports, break up, celebrate Christmas and a whole lot more.

episodes.name: Aging, Interviews and Exes
episodes.overview: The How to Be a Grown Up comics provide jokes and personal anecdotes on how to interview for a job, own a pet, deal with an ex, renovate your home and a whole lot more.

episodes.name: Dating, Sleeping and Birthday Parties
episodes.overview: The How to Be a Grown Up comics provide jokes and personal anecdotes on how to sleep, get your partner to change, celebrate a birthday, be a little league parent and a whole lot more.

episodes.name: Sports, Chores and Couples Therapy
episodes.overview: The How to Be a Grown Up comics provide jokes and personal anecdotes on how to be a sports fan, do chores, stay healthy, celebrate your Anniversary and a whole lot more.

episodes.name: Kids, Coolness and Car Lots
episodes.overview: The comics provide jokes and personal anecdotes on how to be cool, watch TV, buy a car, remain faithful and a whole lot more.

episodes.name: Movies, Funerals and Favors
episodes.overview: Jokes and personal anecdotes on how to gamble, ask a favor, go to a movie, reinvent yourself and a whole lot more.

episodes.name: Reading, Roommates and Revenge
episodes.overview: Topics include: Revenge; aging; parties.

episodes.name: Childcare, Bucket Lists and Valentine's Day
episodes.overview: The How to Be a Grown Up comics provide jokes and personal anecdotes on how to impress your friends, lie to your kids, make a bucket list, navigate Valentine's Day and a whole lot more.

episodes.name: Mortality, Religion and Gettin' Freaky
episodes.overview: The comics provide jokes and personal anecdotes on how to get freaky, end a friendship, navigate religion, give feedback, face your own mortality, and a whole lot more.Source: truTV
